chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Health Care Form, Received and Filed

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court by video (audio issues), in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court in person for Vann Darnell Pope.  Attorney Samuel Tufford on behalf of Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Jury Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in Trial posture. State informs the Court that the charging ADA has conflicting Trials and requests an adjournment. Court denies the motion. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on November 7, 2022. 

Defense Counsel informs the court that he still needs to review Medical Test results with the Defendant.

Speedy Trial Demand placed on the Record by Defense Counsel. Speedy Trial expires February 1, 2023. 

Matter is adjourned.
Order for Testing Pursuant to 968.38(2m), WIS. STAT. signed and filed.
ORDER FOR TESTING PURSUANT TO 968.38(2M), WIS.STAT., received and filed.

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran appeared by video for Vann Darnell Pope.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court to address bail.  

Case was previously set for trial in which they were unable to proceed do to State's witnesses.  Defense request court modify bail to $20,000.00.  State objects and place reasons on the record.  Court DENIES the defense request.

The Jury Trial set for 11/14 is vacated, set on date in error.

Court orders case adjourned for jury status hearing and jury trial
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Vann Darnell Pope. Defendant Vann Darnell Pope not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 6. Case set for Jury Trial. State request an adjournment due to wetness unavailability. Defense request to be heard on bail. Court will set a new trial date and bail hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 6.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION, received and filed.
NOTICE OF MOTION TO ADJOURN, received and filed.
received and filed.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements, received and filed.
Order Allowing Incarcerated Defendant to View Discovery on Computer Disc, signed and filed.
Jury trial on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Allowing Incarcerated Defendant to View Discovery on Computer Discs, received.
NOTICE OF EXPERT TESTIMONY AND SUPPLEMENT TO STATE'S WITNESS LIST, received and filed.

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Pretrial issues addressed.  Standard Motions in Limine filed. Defendant remains in trial posture.  Court provides notice that Judge Wagner will be the trial judge.  Case is adjourned for jury trial on August 29, 2022.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Vann Darnell Pope not in court, in custody. Emily Zimmel for Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail review.  The bail review was held in person.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  The court order the matter adjourned.
 All parties are notified that effective 8-1-22, this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, Branch 6, in room 506 of the Safety Building.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Notice of Expert Testimony and Supplement to State Witness List
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; NOTICE OF INTENT TO USE VIDEO RECORDED STATEMENT AT TRIAL PURSUANT TO Wis.Stat.
908.08(2)(a
Scheduling Order signed by ALL PARTIES in court.
Court reduces cash bail from $50,000.00 to $40,000.00. ALL OTHER PREVIOUS TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF BAIL ARE TO REMAIN.

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court with attorney James Edgar Toran. Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in custody. Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for bail/bond hearing. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted in part by the Court.  Cash Bail set at $40,000.00. All other previous terms and conditions of bail remain. Defense requests jury trial dates. Scheduling Order completed in Court. Case remains calendared before Br. 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; MOTION FOR BAIL MODIFICATION

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court with Attorney James Edgar Toran; both appear by video.  Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Hunter. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 026869,

Amount: $20.00

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with  NSC, SAC.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to remain in custody until a device becomes available.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Vann Darnell Pope in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
